intro: Anacampseros septentrionalis, commonly known as the northern starwort, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Portulacaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, storing water in its thick leaves. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in desert or semi-desert habitats. Anacampseros septentrionalis is a perennial herb that blooms in the spring and summer months.
